meanings.definition: To encircle or bind with a belt or band
meanings.sent1: She will gird her waist with a belt for the dress.
meanings.sent2: He always girds his robe tightly before going out.
meanings.sent3: The superhero girded herself with a magical belt to fight evil.
meanings.sent4: The fortress girded by high walls stood strong against the enemy.
meanings.sent5: The knight girded his sword, ready for battle.

meanings.definition: To prepare oneself for action or confrontation
meanings.sent1: Before the speech, he will gird himself with confidence.
meanings.sent2: She girded herself mentally before facing the challenge.
meanings.sent3: The student girded for the exam by studying all night.
meanings.sent4: The team girded for the match with intense training.
meanings.sent5: He girded his mind with determination to overcome the obstacle.

meanings.definition: To surround or enclose with a belt or band
meanings.sent1: The tree was girded by a colorful ribbon for the festival.
meanings.sent2: They girded the gift with a beautiful bow.
meanings.sent3: The garden was girded by a fence to keep the rabbits out.
meanings.sent4: The city was girded by a river, creating a natural boundary.
meanings.sent5: She girded the book with a leather cover to protect it.
